abstract: Health dept officials in Genesee County, Mich, say Flint area residents are experiencing increase in gastrointestinal illness shigellosis, transmitted through poor hygiene, particularly by food handlers; contributing to rise in bacterial illness is fact that residents of Flint, continuing to distrust their city's water, are washing their hands less frequently or with inadequate amounts of soap and water.

headline.print_headline: Bacterial Illness on the Rise in Flint as Residents Shun City Water
headline.main: Flint Hit With Bacterial Illness as Residents Shun City Water

snippet: An outbreak of shigellosis, a bacterial illness that is transmitted when people do not wash their hands, is rising in Genesee County, home to the city of Flint....
lead_paragraph: An outbreak of shigellosis, a bacterial illness that is transmitted when people do not wash their hands, is rising in Genesee County, home to the city of Flint.
